page.title: 03Churches
page.content: There are five churches in use in the area; two are non-conformist chapels at Christian Malford and Kington Langley; the third is on the Draycot estate; and those at Christian Malford and Sutton Benger are two of the three Church of England churches for which the Rev. Lord Milverton is Rector. There is also a disused chapel at Draycot Cerne. The medieval church in Sutton Benger has a 13th century carving of the old pagan god "the Green Man", which is one of the finest prominent examples in English Church Architecture. There is also a sample of medieval embroidery there. The Green Man is being used as the emblem for the Church Roof Fund, launched in 1985 to raise Â£50,000 for roof repairs. Repairs were last carried out in 1849.
